name: XCP-D-BIDS
description: A Robust Postprocessing Pipeline of fMRI data
command-line: mkdir -p work; export FS_LICENSE=$PWD/[FS_LICENSE_FILE]; xcp_d [SUBJECT_PREPROC_FMRI_DIR] [OUTPUT_DIR] participant --omp-nthreads 2 [MODE] [COMBINERUNS] [VERBOSE] [INPUT_TYPE] [TASK] [SMOOTHING] [DESPIKE] [LINC_QC] [MIN_TIME] [NUISANCE] --fs-license-file [FS_LICENSE_FILE] [DUMMY_SCANS] [BPF] [LOWER_BPF] [UPPER_BPF] [BPF_ORDER] [MOTION_FILTER_TYPE] [BAND_STOP_MIN] [BAND_STOP_MAX] [MOTION_FILTER_ORDER] [HEAD_RADIUS] [FD_THRESH] [WARP_SURFACES] [BIDS_FILTER] -w work --notrack

inputs.description: The root folder of a preprocessed fMRI output from Nibabies, fMRIPREP, or DCAN/HCP outputs that are formed as BIDS derivatives.
inputs.name: preproc_fmri_dir

inputs.description: The name of the folder to store outputs of XCPD processing.
inputs.name: output_dir
Combine runs
inputs.description: Combines all runs into one file.

inputs.name: Verbose
inputs.description: Increases log verbosity

inputs.name: Input type
inputs.description: fMRIPprep/nibabies are default structures, DCAN and HCP are optional

inputs.name: mode
inputs.description: The mode of operation for XCP-D. The mode sets several parameters, with values specific to different pipelines. For more information, see the documentation at https://xcp-d.readthedocs.io/en/latest/workflows.html#modes

inputs.name: Task ID
inputs.description: select a specific task to be selected for the postprocessing

inputs.name: Smoothing
inputs.description: Smoothing the postprocessed output (fwhm)

inputs.name: min_time
inputs.description: Minimum amount of time (in seconds) that a run must have following censoring for it to be processed.

inputs.name: Despike
inputs.description: Despike the nifti/cifti before postprocessing

inputs.name: LINC QC
inputs.description: Add LINC QC to the output

inputs.name: Nuisance regressors
inputs.description: Nuisance parameters to be selected

inputs.name: Dummy time
inputs.description: Number of volumes to remove from the beginning of each run. If set to auto, xcp_d will extract non-steady-state volume indices from the preprocessing derivatives’ confounds file.

inputs.name: Disable Bandpass Filter
inputs.description: Disable bandpass filtering. If bandpass filtering is disabled, then ALFF derivatives will not be calculated.

inputs.name: Lower cut-off frequency
inputs.description: Lower cut-off frequency (Hz) for the butterworth bandpass filter

inputs.name: Upper cut-off frequency
inputs.description: Upper cut-off frequency (Hz) for the butterworth bandpass filter

inputs.name: Butterworth bandpass filter
inputs.description: Number of filter coefficients for butterworth bandpass filter

inputs.name: Type of band-stop filter
inputs.description: Type of band-stop filter to use for removing respiratory artifact from motion regressors

inputs.name: Lower frequency (bpm)
inputs.description: Lower frequency (bpm) for the band-stop motion filter

inputs.name: Upper frequency (bpm)
inputs.description: Upper frequency (bpm) for the band-stop motion filter

inputs.name: Filter coeffecients (band-stop filter)
inputs.description: Number of filter coeffecients for the band-stop filter

inputs.name: Head radius
inputs.description: Head radius for computing FD, default is 50mm, 35mm is recommended for baby

inputs.name: Framewise displacement
inputs.description: Framewise displacement threshold for censoring

inputs.name: Warp surfaces
inputs.description: If used, a workflow will be run to warp native-space (fsnative) reconstructed cortical surfaces (surf.gii files) produced by Freesurfer into standard (fsLR) space. These surface files are primarily used for visual quality assessment. By default, this workflow is disabled. IMPORTANT: This parameter can only be run if the –cifti flag is also enabled.

inputs.name: BIDS Filter File
inputs.description: A JSON file defining BIDS input filters using PyBIDS.

inputs.name: fs_license_file
inputs.description: Path to FreeSurfer license key file. Get it (for free) by registering at https://surfer.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu/registration.html

inputs.name: preproc_output_json
inputs.description: The json descriptor of the original fmri preprocessing derivatives.
